item.title: Overview of the European Democracy Action Plan
item.description:
Professor Lorna Woods, University of Essex The European Democracy Action Plan (EDAP) is one piece of a larger effort to regulate the online world. Unveiled as a key initiative by Commission President von der Leyen, it joins upcoming legislation like the Digital Services Act (DSA) and Digital Markets Act (DMA). These measures signal a change in how the EU approaches internet regulation and raise questions about the EU’s authority in this space...

item.title: The proposal by the EU Commission regarding the regulation of media freedom.
item.description:
Lorna Woods, Professor of Internet Law, University of Essex Photo credit: Bin im Garten, via Wikimedia Commons In the 2021 State of the Union address, EU Commission President von der Leyen underscored the importance of media independence, stating that Europe needs a law to protect it. The proposed Media Freedom Act (MFA) aims to address this, building upon existing regulations like the Audiovisual Media Services Directive (AVMSD) and the Digital Services Act (DSA)...
